intro: Hechtia fragilis, commonly known as the brittle hechtia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces striking inflorescences with vibrant orange or red flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in rocky or limestone areas. Due to its delicate nature, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
